page.title: 03Ecology of S.E. Guildford
page.content:
The White Lane area is mainly open fields. At White Lane Farm a natural hedge has been formed along the line of a former fence, due to natural dispersal of the seeds by birds. In the wood nearby there are many coniferous trees and a thick undergrowth of ferns.
In Chilworth there are some footpaths and open fields by a river. There are also many small winding lanes in this area and very little pollution.
The Chantries is a woodland with equal amounts of deciduous and coniferous trees. In the thick undergrowth there are many foxes and rabbits. The ground is mainly sandy with some clay. The Pilgrims' Way runs along beside this wood and there is a natural spring nearby.
